oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Hallmarks of Country Music - Barbara Mandrell
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of an interview of Barbara Mandrell (musician). The interview is hosted by Rick Phillips (army sergeant/ radio host) for the Hallmarks of Country Music segment. The tape was recorded on an unidentified date.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Barbara Mandrell; Rick Phillips
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Barbara Mandrell introduction -- (00:37) Barbara Mandrell commercial spot for the Hallmarks of Country Music program -- (01:10) Hallmarks of Country Music introduction tune [featuring Rick Phillips voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (01:42) Yogurt commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (02:46) Keep on Singing (Barbara Mandrell) -- (05:27) Rick Phillips introduces Mandrell who discusses her time performing military shows -- (09:14) Wonder When My Baby's Coming Home (Barbara Mandrell) -- (11:21) Alcoholism commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (12:17) Phillips performs a military communications radio spot -- (12:53) After Closing Time (Barbara Mandrell and David Houston) -- (14:59) Phillips asks where Mandrell's country roots came from and what lead her to Tennessee -- (19:13) Holdin' on (To the Love I Got) (Barbara Mandrell) -- (21:22) Champus commercial radio spot hosted by an unidentified voice -- (21:51) Show Me (Barbara Mandrell) -- (24:10) Phillips asks about the amount of practice Mandrell still participates in -- (25:57) A Perfect Match (David Houston and Barbara Mandrell) -- (28:05) Barbara Mandrell commercial spot for the Hallmarks of Country Music program (28:11) Phillips Sudden Infant Death commercial spot -- (29:08) Give a Little, Take a Little (Barbara Mandrell) -- (31:43) Phillips Alcohol and Drug Control Officer commercial spot -- (32:23) Satisfied (Barbara Mandrell) -- (34:46) Mandrell and Phillips discuss Mandrell's extended time traveling -- (38:22) Tonight My Baby's Coming Home (Barbara Mandrell) -- (40:19) United States Customs commercial spot hosted by an unidentified host -- (41:34) Phillips inquires about the early days of country music and the lack of female presence -- (45:47) This Time I Almost Made it (Barbara Mandrell) -- (48:02) Phillips performs a Stamps by Mail commercial spot -- (48:45) Midnight Oil (Barbara Mandrell) -- (51:20) Barbara Mandrell reflects on how she chooses her music and "Midnight Oil" -- (54:16) Hallmarks outro tune [featuring Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified]) -- (56:12) Phillips introduces next weeks guest: Jerry Reed -- (56:20) Lord Mr. Ford (Jerry Reed) -- (59:31) Reed reflects on how he dropped out from school at an early age -- (1:00:35) Hallmarks outro tune [featuring Phillips outro voiceover] ([Unidentified])
